Articles.Content:
BATTLE

Open for anyone.

In this battle you can have up to 2 ships with a max combined mass of 100t.

You will face off against twin Nightmares, good luck.

persist download

*yoink*

Just finished preparing the last craft for SP+.

The carriers had to be rebuilt form the ground up.

Are all our old aircraft going to be compatible with 0.25? I hope so or I've got a lot of rebuilding to do...

Speaking of aircraft I've finally got the new fighter working. Turns out the engine was blocked by the long tail piece and just needed to be moved slightly further back.

Are all our old aircraft going to be compatible with 0.25? I hope so or I've got a lot of rebuilding to do...

Speaking of aircraft I've finally got the new fighter working. Turns out the engine was blocked by the long tail piece and just needed to be moved slightly further back.

http://i.imgur.com/8HAKQ8a.png

http://i.imgur.com/oAVUDm3.png

That looks like one of those soviet prop-jet hybrids. Of course, I preferred the old Sabre, but that looks like a classic Mig on steroids. I like it.

That looks like one of those soviet prop-jet hybrids.

As we don't have props that's generally the look I try to go for. The Yak 15 is one of my favourites. If only they'd given the Spit the same treatment...

As we don't have props that's generally the look I try to go for. The Yak 15 is one of my favourites. If only they'd given the Spit the same treatment...

I personally prefer the Hawker Tempest. I still have fond memories of flying it in IL2 1946.

I personally prefer the Hawker Tempest. I still have fond memories of flying it in IL2 1946.

Tempest is also a very nice aircraft. Underrated as well. There was only one version of the Tempest in 1946 which was annoying.

Tempest is also a very nice aircraft. Underrated as well. There was only one version of the Tempest in 1946 which was annoying.

But there was the Mistel...

One stray bullet=death.
I actually saw a MiG 15 in Yeovilton a few days ago, up close they're absolutely beautiful. Frozen's jet only slightly resembles one but I don't know what it's based on (if anything).

Are all our old aircraft going to be compatible with 0.25? I hope so or I've got a lot of rebuilding to do...

Speaking of aircraft I've finally got the new fighter working. Turns out the engine was blocked by the long tail piece and just needed to be moved slightly further back.

http://i.imgur.com/8HAKQ8a.png

http://i.imgur.com/oAVUDm3.png

This is just in-case they spring SP+ on us without warning I have these as backups and the originals stay as they are.

Iamonfire who goes first?

(so heavily WIP that the two differ already)

Edited August 21, 2014 by Spartwo
Who ever has the lightest vessel.

I guess that's you then

IT'S SO TINY:D

Edited August 22, 2014 by Spartwo

I actually saw a MiG 15 in Yeovilton a few days ago, up close they're absolutely beautiful. Frozen's jet only slightly resembles one but I don't know what it's based on (if anything).

Its meant to look very loosely like a P-47 crossed with a Hurricane. However as we don't have props I've had to stick a jet underneath.

A Yak-15 would need a smaller jet engine part. (Which I also hope we get eventually)

note: Yak 15 and Mig 15 are different aircraft.... Yeah it looks nothing like a Mig.
I see, I would also like smaller jets, mainly for little drones.

I see, I would also like smaller jets, mainly for little drones.

Smaller jets would be excellent... then I can complete my arsenal.

I already have a prototype, but until smaller jets are made stock, I can't complete it.

A smaller radial intake would also be greatly appreciated...

Also, some missile views. This is the long range tomahawk cruise missile prototype with a reinforced warhead. Will update with jet engine if it is added to the stock game. The missile views are from the TERCOM navigation system.

Nose-mounted seeker/TERCOM SAR radar sensor view.

Missile in flight cruises at mach 2.

PS: Missile is VLS launched with a separating booster. Im contemplating integrating dedicated VLS launch cells into the I-mast destroyer.

Edited August 22, 2014 by andrew123

Turn 1 file:persist

T0 start things off I send one of my SNSS Nightmares to hunt down your PTV: WIP.

Take aim...

FIRE!

It's a killing blow.

Your move
First Test of the new Mk-II Frigate. Firing a full broadside here.

First Test of the new Mk-II Frigate. Firing a full broadside here.

http://i.imgur.com/v2s3dUW.png

Hmm... I need to see how the independence fares against that ship. Could you try firing salvos at my LCS?

Turn 1 file:persist

Your move

I guess my d/v calculations were off. To a higher orbit I suppose(Or maybe Gilly, I like gilly)

Erm... I just watched the LOK season 3 finale... that was pretty extreme, considering they marked it as a "children's show". I mean, the main character gets mercury poisoning and gets confined to a wheelchair.... and this is the sequel to the last airbender. 0_o

The next season's going to be pretty dark... they included anarchist terrorists hell-bent on assassinations, world leaders getting assassinated, political and social issues, and even technological development from airships to radios and even moving pictures (Rockets are coming into play, I presume)... Pretty interesting "children's show".

Considering my experience of a minor run-in with mercury poisoning as a toddler, that was pretty interesting.

Also, I really want to petition squad to implement small jets.

Anyways, back on topic!

I introduce the BUFF. Operation Linbacker, here I come! The NVA'll never know what hit 'em! (It even includes an engine inspections system which allows ground crews to open up and maintain the large engines.)

It has a HUGE bomb bay.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Prototype of the aerially deployed naval minefield. Any vessel hitting this area denial weapon at a high speed is a goner.

I just need to perfect the dispersion system.

Naval mine laying vessel incoming.

My strategy underwent a revamp. I lay mines around the hostile fleet, preventing them from escaping, and then I subsequently destroy the vessels at range using my tomahawk cruise missiles. My AIM-9X and Iron Pike missiles could also work.

Edited August 25, 2014 by andrew123
Hmm... seems awfully quiet here...

Hmm... seems awfully quiet here...

Was thinking the same. :/ Most of us haven't been online for a while.
I've been waiting for Spartwo to take his turn.

Yeah, start of college affecting anyone else? I know that has very much eaten into my KSP playing time. That and I've been trying out some mods. If anyone wants to battle I'll be up for it, just don't expect super quick responses.

Erm... I just watched the LOK season 3 finale... that was pretty extreme, considering they marked it as a "children's show". I mean, the main character gets mercury poisoning and gets confined to a wheelchair.... and this is the sequel to the last airbender. 0_o

The next season's going to be pretty dark... they included anarchist terrorists hell-bent on assassinations, world leaders getting assassinated, political and social issues, and even technological development from airships to radios and even moving pictures (Rockets are coming into play, I presume)... Pretty interesting "children's show".

Considering my experience of a minor run-in with mercury poisoning as a toddler, that was pretty interesting.

Also, I really want to petition squad to implement small jets.

Anyways, back on topic!

I introduce the BUFF. Operation Linbacker, here I come! The NVA'll never know what hit 'em! (It even includes an engine inspections system which allows ground crews to open up and maintain the large engines.)

http://i.imgur.com/UdBODWS.png

It has a HUGE bomb bay.

http://imgur.com/a/gJa51

Prototype of the aerially deployed naval minefield. Any vessel hitting this area denial weapon at a high speed is a goner.

http://i.imgur.com/lSP9Ws6.png

I just need to perfect the dispersion system.

Naval mine laying vessel incoming.

My strategy underwent a revamp. I lay mines around the hostile fleet, preventing them from escaping, and then I subsequently destroy the vessels at range using my tomahawk cruise missiles. My AIM-9X and Iron Pike missiles could also work.

None of my vessels go over 10 m/s, those mines would be completely useless against them.
